doc.field: James A. Hayden Photographs and Memorabilia
James A. Hayden Photographs and Memorabilia

James A. Hayden (d. 1943) worked as a columnist for the Irish Echo newspaper in the 1930s and early 1940s. Starting in 1928, Hayden also worked as a radio broadcaster, hosting the program Irish Memories at local station WEVD. The James A. Hayden Photographs and Memorabilia collection consists primarily of photographs and negatives collected by Hayden in his capacity as a columnist for the Irish Echo. The photographs include portraits, social and cultural events, as well as groups of people. Additional materials in this collection include some VHS tapes, an audio reel, news clippings and memorabilia. This collection also includes photographs and personal items belonging to Hayden's daughter, Dorothy Hayden Cudahy, and son-in-law, John J. Cudahy.

James A. Hayden (d. 1943) worked as a columnist for the Irish Echo newspaper in the 1930s and early 1940s. Starting in 1928, Hayden also worked as a radio broadcaster, hosting the program Irish Memories at local station WEVD. The James A. Hayden Photographs and Memorabilia collection consists primarily of photographs and negatives collected by Hayden in his capacity as a columnist for the Irish Echo. The photographs include portraits, social and cultural events, as well as groups of people. Additional materials in this collection include some VHS tapes, an audio reel, news clippings and memorabilia. This collection also includes photographs and personal items belonging to Hayden's daughter, Dorothy Hayden Cudahy, and son-in-law, John J. Cudahy.

The James A. Hayden Photographs and Memorabilia collection consists primarily of photographs and negatives collected by Hayden in his capacity as a columnist for the Irish Echo. The photographs include portraits, social and cultural events, as well as groups of people. Additional materials in this collection include some VHS tapes, an audio reel, news clippings, and memorabilia.

This collection also includes photographs featuring Dorothy Hayden Cudahy and John J. Cudahy, their honeymoon notebook, an audio reel entitled "D. Cudahy," and John Cudahy's elementary school diploma and award.

James A. Hayden (d. 1943) worked as a columnist for the Irish Echo newspaper in the 1930s and early 1940s. Starting in 1928, Hayden also worked as a radio broadcaster, hosting the program Irish Memories at local station WEVD. After Hayden's death in 1943, his daughter, Dorothy Hayden Cudahy, became the host of Irish Memories until 1990. Dorothy Hayden Cudahy married John J. Cudahy in 1947 and they went on to have one son, Sean, in 1950.
The provenance of materials found in this collection are unknown.

Audiovisual materials have not been preserved and may not be available to researchers. Materials not yet digitized will need to have access copies made before they can be used. To request an access copy, or if you are unsure if an item has been digitized, please contact Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, special.collections@nyu.edu, 212-998-2596 with the collection name, collection number, and a description of the item(s) requested. A staff member will respond to you with further information.
